member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Controls.ArrowButton
member.summary: Represents a Measurement Studio Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) button control that displays Boolean data and is in the shape of an arrow.
member.remarks:
You can use to set the direction of the to , , , or . You can set the color of the to change depending on the state of the by using and to set a different color when the is or . Use to set the
to respond to three different types of click events: , , and .
To configure the for different mechanical actions, use the following settings:
To configure the to switch states when pressed, set to and to .
To configure the to switch states when released, set to and to .
To configure the to switch states until released, set to N/A and to .

member.name: E:NationalInstruments.Controls.BooleanButton.PreviewValueChanged
member.summary: Occurs before the property is interactively changed.
member.remarks: This is a tunneling routed event. You can use this event to cancel a toggle operation caused by user interaction. Mark the event as handled in the event handler to cancel the operation.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Controls.BooleanContentButton
member.summary: Represents a Measurement Studio Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) button control that supports different content for the and states.
member.remarks:
This class is commonly used to change the color of the button when the button changes from true to false or vice versa, using the and properties. However, you can also use the to display text or images that are different depending on whether the is in a true or false state using the and properties. To display an image, set one of these content properties to be an control. To display text, use a . To display formatted text, use a control.
Alternatively, you can set the color of the to change depending on the state of the by using and by setting a different color when the is or . Use to set the
to respond to three different types of click events: , , and .
To configure the for different mechanical actions, use the following settings:
To configure the to switch states when pressed, set to and to .
To configure the to switch states when released, set to and to .
To configure the to switch states until released, set to N/A and to .

member.returns: The identifier for the dependency property.

member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the dependency property.

member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the dependency property.

member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the dependency property.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Controls.BooleanContentButton.FalseContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the content to display when is .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Controls.BooleanContentButton.TrueContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the content to display when is .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Controls.BooleanContentButton.FalseBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush that is used to alter the color of the when is .
member.value: The default value is , but derived controls and styles may redefine this.
member.remarks: Deriving classes and styles will consume this property differently. For example, will only change the color of text content on the , but a with a SquareLED style has its entire color changed.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Controls.BooleanContentButton.TrueBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush that is used to alter the color of the when is .
member.value: The default value is , but derived controls and styles may redefine this.
member.remarks: Deriving classes and styles consume this property differently. For example, only changes the color of text content on the , but a with a SquareLED style has its entire color changed.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Controls.LED
member.summary: Represents a Measurement Studio Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) button control in the shape of a light emitting diode.
member.remarks:
Typically, you use an control to display Boolean data. You can use to change the appearance of the . The property of the indicates the current state of the control. You can change the value programmatically, by clicking the control, or by pressing the space bar when the control has focus.
To configure the for different mechanical actions, use the following settings:
To configure the to switch states when pressed, set to and to .
To configure the to switch states when released, set to and to .
To configure the to switch states until released, set to N/A and to .

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Controls.Switch
member.summary: Represents a Measurement Studio Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) switch control to display and input Boolean states.
member.remarks:
Typically, you use a control to display Boolean data. You can use to change the appearance of the . The property of the indicates the current state of the control. You can change the value programmatically, by clicking the control, or by pressing the space bar when the control has focus.
To configure the for different mechanical actions, use the following settings:
To configure the to switch states when pressed, set to and to .
To configure the to switch states when released, set to and to .
To configure the to switch states until released, set to N/A and to .
